transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: Alright everyone, let's get started. Today we're going to discuss the Q1 roadmap and the Enrollment API migration.

transcripts.speaker: Marcus Webb
transcripts.text: Thanks Sarah. So the main question is whether we can maintain backward compatibility through Q1 while we roll out v2.

transcripts.speaker: Patrick
transcripts.text: I've looked at the downstream consumers. We have about 15 active integrations. I think we need at least 8 weeks notice for the deprecation.

transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: That makes sense. Let's decide to keep v1 available through end of Q1. Marcus, can you audit all the downstream consumers by next Friday?

transcripts.speaker: Marcus Webb
transcripts.text: Sure, I can do that. I'll also check with the mobile team about their migration timeline.

transcripts.speaker: Patrick
transcripts.text: Great. I'll draft the deprecation timeline and send it to the team by January 20th. We should prioritize mobile clients for v2 support.

transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: Agreed. Let's also use feature flags for the gradual rollout. I'll schedule a partner communication sync for next week.

transcripts.speaker: Marcus Webb
transcripts.text: One more thing - should we consider the Project Alpha integration? They're our biggest API consumer.

transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: Good point. Patrick, can you reach out to the Project Alpha team directly? They'll need special attention during this migration.

transcripts.speaker: Patrick
transcripts.text: Will do. I'll set up a call with Jordan from their team this week.
